intro: Chromatotriccum quadriquetrum, commonly known as the four-leaf clover, is a small flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia, typically growing in grassy areas and woodland edges. The plant is characterized by its distinctive four-leaf structure, which is rare and considered a symbol of good luck. Its small white or pale yellow flowers are arranged in umbels, and it has a slender, branching stem. The leaves are trifoliate, with three to four leaflets, depending on the individual plant.
